com.goodworkalan.ilk.association
Class IlkAssociation<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.goodworkalan.ilk.association.IlkAssociation<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of value associated.
public class IlkAssociation<T>
extends Object

Associates a value to a type by either matching the a given super type token exactly, mapping an annotation applied to the class, or by matching any super type token whose type is assignable to the type in a given super type token. These three different match conditions are specified independently, so that you can chose to associate by class, by annotation, or by class and its descendants.

You specify an association by an exact match using the exact method. A match by an annotation applied to a class is specified using the annotated method. A match specified by matching any class that is assignable to a given class is specified by the derived method.

An exact match will take precedence over an annotation or assignment match. An annotation match will take precedence over an assignment match.

This class is thread safe. All associations are stored in concurrent maps so the behavior associated with concurrent maps, where a value written in one thread is not yet be readable in another thread until the write is complete, applies to this class.

After an association lookup, the result is cached, so that reflection and class hierarchy navigation does not have to be repeated. Assigning new associations resets the cache.

The concurrency model is designed to support the use of the IlkAssociation class as a static object. If there is a static association of helper objects by type, a new class may be loaded by the class loader, initialize itself in its static initialization block by registering a helper object for its type, and the helper object would be ready for lookup by the time an instance of newly loaded object needed its helper object.

Constructor Detail

IlkAssociation

public IlkAssociation(boolean multi)
Create an empty class association that stores multiple values for a mapping if the value given for multi is true.

Parameters:
multi - If true, multiple values are associated with each mapping, if false an new mapping value replaces the old mapping value.

IlkAssociation

public IlkAssociation(IlkAssociation<T> copy)
Create an ilk association that is a copy of the given ilk association. All of the internal state is copied, so that changes made to the copied class association do not affect the new class association.

Parameters:
copy - The class association to copy.
Method Detail

exact

public void exact(Ilk.Key key,
                  T value)
Map the givenvalue to the given ilk key exactly. Sub-classes or implementations of the given type will not be associated with the given value as a result of this association.

This method is thread safe since all mappings are kept in concurrent maps.

Calling this method will reset the internal cache of resolved mappings.

While this method is synchronized, the get methods are not. This method is synchronized to prevent read write conflicts of the list of values that is mapped to each raw type. The list is itself unsynchronized, so new items are added via a copy. The synchronization prevents the read-write conflict where two threads create a copy, then one thread after another adds an item to their isolated copy and returns the copy to the items by class map. Because the map is a concurrent map and because the lists are never changed after they have been added to the map, map lookup does not need to be synchronized.

Parameters:
type - The type.
value - The value to associate with the type.

add

private Map<Ilk.Key,List<T>> add(Map<Class<?>,Map<Ilk.Key,List<T>>> map,
                                 Ilk.Key key,
                                 List<T> values)
Create a deep copy of the ilk pair list found in the given map using the raw class of the given key and then add the given value to the list of values paired with the given key. If this is not a multi association, the copied list is cleared before the value is added.

Parameters:
map - The map.
key - The key.
value - The value.
Returns:
A copy of the ilk pair list with the value added to the list associated with the key.

copy

private Map<Ilk.Key,List<T>> copy(Class<?> rawClass,
                                  Map<Class<?>,Map<Ilk.Key,List<T>>> map)
Create a copy of ilk to queue pair list in the given map for the given raw class, or create a new list if the key does not exist.

Parameters:
map - The map.
rawClass - The key.
Returns:
A queue that contains the elements currently associated with key that need to be preserved when a new value is associated with the key.

assignable

public void assignable(Ilk.Key key,
                       T value)
Map the given value to the type represented by the given ilk key, sub-classes of the given type or implementations of the given type . The value will match an assignable association if there is no exact association or annotation association that matches the given type in this class association.

If a type can match multiple super-classes or interfaces, it will match the first mapping or interface association encountered when inspecting the class and super classes of given type. The class is first tested, then each super-class of the class it tested, from the class itself up the inheritance hierarchy to Object. For each class in the hierarchy, all of the interfaces implemented by the class and all of the interfaces that those interfaces extend are checked for a derived association. The first derived association to match is returned.

If a class directly implements or an interface directly extends two or more interfaces that have a derived association, there is no telling which of the two or more associations will be chosen. Otherwise, you can determine which derived association will be chosen by working your way up the class and interface hierarchy according to the rules.

Parameters:
key - The super type token.
converter - The value to associate with the type.

annotated

public void annotated(Class<? extends Annotation> annotation,
                      T value)
Map the given value to classes annotated with the given annotation type. The value will match a annotated association if there is no exact association that matches the given type. If a type is annotated by two ore more annotations that have associated values, their is no telling which of the values will be returned.

Annotations applied to super-classes or interfaces implemented by the type will not be considered when determining the match.

Parameters:
type - The annotation type.
converter - The value to associate with the annotation type.

Get the object converter for the given object type.

The object converter.

cache

public void cache(Ilk.Key key,
                  List<T> values)
Often times the contents have typed values, ilk created, so it's best to poke it in through the front, since that's where the compiler type information will be. Tried having a missing method, but there was no type information with ilk.

Parameters:
key - The key.
values - The cache values.
